alert.note: Alert for Berkeley; Charleston; Colleton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 13 at 5:05PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley, Charleston, Colleton and Dorchester. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 502 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated showers and thunderstorms with torrential rainfall extending from Jacksonboro to West Ashley and North Charleston. As much 1 to 2 inches of rain has fallen in some areas. Through 6 PM, expect another 1 to 2 inches of rain to fall across the advisory area. The risk for minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas continues. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Summerville, Goose Creek, Hanahan, West Ashley, Johns Island, I-26/I-526 Interchange, Ladson, Downtown Charleston, Naval Weapons Station Charleston, Hollywood, Ravenel, Meggett, Delemar Crossroads, Yonges Island, Adams Run, Magnolia Gardens, Charleston Airport, Jacksonboro and College Park.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 1-888-383-2024 or email your reports to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
